title: Karachi dyeing factory fire engulfs 80% of building
desc: Chief fire officer says two firefighters sustain minor injuries as fire is brought under control after two hours

title: US superiority over Iran is obvious, the endgame is not
desc: The real question is not whether the United States can destroy Iran’s capabilities, but whether it can end the Islamic Republic—and control what follows.

title: B.C.'s minimum wage will soon increase and here's how much more you'll make
desc: The Ministry of Labour announced today that B.C.'s minimum wage workers will see an hourly pay raise of about 2.2 per cent.

title: Firefox adds an AI killswitch
desc: Firefox is rolling out an AI killswitch with its latest update.

title: Yuja Wang accuses Radio 3’s Norman Lebrecht of misogynistic bullying
desc: Station will no longer be working with journalist after pianist makes email public

title: Limerick Greenway tour now available in Virtual Reality
desc: Limerick Greenway has become the first in the country to use Virtual Reality technology to deliver a digital tour of its entire route.

title: FCCPC says it uncovered patterns of price manipulation by domestic airlines during festive season
desc: The Federal Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (FCCPC) says it has uncovered patterns of price manipulation by some domestic airlines during the December 2025 festive season.

title: year contract at Brentford
desc: Keith Andrews has signed a six-year contract with Brentford after a dream start to his managerial career in the Premier League.

title: Presidency Backs Campaign Against Social Vices in Schools
desc: The Presidency donates N50m to a special committee to combat rising social vices in schools, calling for a nationwide collaborative effort to guide youths.

title: Relief Items Delivered to Ekiti Rainstorm Victims by NEMA
desc: Senate Leader Opeyemi Bamidele and NEMA have distributed relief materials to thousands of Ekiti rainstorm victims whose homes were recently destroyed.
